Kayako - ticket id 60069509 // Syed Haider commented publicly: Dear Alex,

Thank you for letting us know that the license is now registering—that’s great news!

The error you're currently seeing within GFI AppManager is not a critical issue. It generally stems from intermittent connection issues between your appliance and the AppManager system. While it may appear concerning, it does not typically affect the core functionality of your appliance.

To resolve this error, please follow the steps outlined in the following guide: Resolving appliance does not have a valid license Error when Migrating or Adding Appliance to AppManager [https://support.appmanager.gfi.com/article/96087-resolving-appliance-does-not-have-a-valid-license-error-when-migrating-or-adding-appliance-to-appmanager]

If the issue still persists, kindly provide the following information. Please be sure to follow the steps in the given order:

	* Enable the additional server debug logs [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/117547] for the App Manager message relevant to this behavior: 
	* Reproduce the behavior by following the steps explained in this quick walkthrough video [https://www.loom.com/share/4a162ee3dc8e40b3b806e55d0eba98a6?sid=a64723ea-0e6b-44fd-9502-a35e6563c803]. 
	* Share a fresh Support Information File by going to Status > System Health > Support Information.

Best regards,
Syed Haider

Kayako - ticket id 60069509 // Syed Haider commented publicly: Dear Alex,

Thank you once again for your continued patience and collaboration while we investigate the license validation issue on your Kerio Control appliance. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience this has caused.

Upon reviewing the debug logs you shared today, we noticed the following critical entries:

[18/Jun/2025 17:12:13] License update failed: Automatic license update failed during attempt to contact registration server: (11) Client-Server communication error.: Could not resolve host: register.kerio.com
[18/Jun/2025 17:22:04] Unable to send alert message. appliance does not have a valid license

These errors indicate a DNS resolution failure, which prevented the system from contacting the licensing server. While you mentioned that a ping to register.kerio.com was successful—which is indeed unusual—the log indicates that DNS resolution failed at the time of the licensing attempt. This suggests a possible transient DNS issue or inconsistent resolver behavior.

To address this, we recommend configuring a DNS forwarding rule specifically for Kerio domains. Please follow the steps outlined in the official guide below to forward all DNS queries for *.kerio.com to public resolvers like 1.1.1.1 and 8.8.8.8: Configuring DNS Forwarding in Kerio Control [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/117686-configuring-dns-forwarding-service-in-kerio-control]

If the issue persists after setting up the forwarding rule, we kindly ask you to re-collect the debug logs, ensuring the following:

	* Clear the current debug log.
	* Enable DNS-related and licensing-related debug messages.
	* Reproduce the issue.
	* Export and share the new debug log file with us.

Additionally, please run the following commands directly from the Kerio Control appliance and share their output with us:

nslookup register.kerio.com
dig register.kerio.com

This will help us verify DNS resolution from the appliance’s environment.

We appreciate your cooperation and look forward to resolving this with you as swiftly as possible.

Best regards,
Syed Haider
GFI - Kerio Control Support Team

Kayako - ticket id 60069509 // Zubair Farooq commented publicly: Dear Alex,

Thanks for your patience while we reviewed this.

If you have SSH access to the instance, we would recommend that you please proceed with the following steps to manually install the license key file using SSH. This process involves accessing the file system directly, which might circumvent the issue you are experiencing:

	* Access Kerio Control via SSH [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/118062-accessing-kerio-control-s-shell-using-ssh]. Use 'root' as username and thhe password for used for admin account on Webadmin .
	* Copy License File: Use SCP (for Unix/Linux systems) or WinSCP (for Windows) to copy the "license.key" file to the directory **/var/winroute/license** on the Kerio Control system.
	* Restart Services. After the file is in place, restart the control services by running the following command: /etc/boxinit.d/60winroute restart

Please let us know if the issue is not resolved.

Best regards,
Zubair Farooq
GFI - Kerio Control Support Team

Kayako - ticket id 60069509 // Syed Haider commented publicly: Dear Alex,

Thank you for your continued patience, and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience this issue has caused.

We’d like to confirm that there is no issue with the license key itself. I have successfully applied the same license key on a test instance without any errors.

image

This confirms that the problem is occurring at the application level on your appliance, rather than at the license level.

Since we see that you are using a virtual appliance, it would be ideal to try spinning up a new virtual machine for Kerio Control and applying the license key to that instance. This test will help us quickly rule out any application-level issues on the current virtual machine.

Upon reviewing the logs you previously shared, we noticed several malformed TCP packet errors and incomplete 3-way handshakes, which could potentially disrupt the license update process:

[10/Jun/2025 11:52:21] DROP malformed TCP packet (illegal TCP ports in packet header),  from VLAN 10, proto:TCP, len:40, 79.124.62.134:0 -> 219.89.126.203:5062, flags:[ SYN ], seq:2663298224 ack:0, win:1024, tcplen:0
```[10/Jun/2025 11:47:58] {pktdrop} packet dropped: 3-way handshake not completed (from Port6 LAN 192.168.2.2, proto:TCP, len:171, 192.168.2.55:63075 -> 52.98.143.114:443, flags:[ FIN ACK PSH ], seq:1645862517 ack:2081381515, win:2048, tcplen:119)``

To address these issues and potentially resolve the license update problem, we recommend the following steps:

	* Disable 3-way handshake as guided in Effects of disabling 3 way handshaking [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/119722].
	* Disable GRO for your interfaces [https://www.loom.com/share/87a73e0af0d046faaabeafbd8b88e30d?sid=35fd909b-c650-4245-b23e-d51037db0217].

If your appliance still gets stuck when attempting to update the license, we will need additional information to continue our investigation. Please provide the following logs after reproducing the issue:

	* Enable the additional server debug logs [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/117547] for the following messages relevant to this behavior: 

	* Licensing Information
	* Crash Reporting
	* Packets Dropped For Some Reason

	* For crashes, please provide the Core dump file [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/116226] located in any of the subfolders under /var/crash; for this, you need to access the SSH console [https://support.keriocontrol.gfi.com/article/118062].

However, we strongly recommend spinning up a new virtual machine and applying the license key there first. I am fairly confident this will resolve the issue. You can then export your settings from the previous virtual machine and import them into the new one.

We completely understand the urgency of this issue. If you still need our assistance after trying the above, please feel free to book a meeting with us using this link after applying the recommendations above: Book 60069509 meeting [https://central-supportdesk.setmore.com/services/00209635-f221-4600-9065-517396feaa06?source=KA-60069509]

> Please note: This session will be used only to collect deeper troubleshooting information by reproducing the issue with the debug logs enabled. Our support scope does not include creating virtual machines or migrating configurations, as per the shared responsibility model—this falls under customer ownership.

Therefore, we urge you to attempt the above steps before scheduling a meeting. If the problem persists after these attempts, we’ll be happy to assist further by collecting and analyzing more detailed data.

Best regards,
Syed Haider
GFI - Kerio Control Support Team

 	* If you are unable to obtain the updated license file online, the articles above recommend contacting GFI Customer Care with your license key, new hardware serial number, and registration details to receive an updated license file.

	* Register the License Offline:

 	* In the Kerio Control Activation Wizard, select the option to register offline by license file.
 	* Upload the new license.key file you obtained from the registration page or Customer Care.

 	* If you continue to experience issues with the registration wizard or offline license upload, ensure your appliance has a stable internet connection and that the system date/time are correct.
